At-a-Glance: Clean kit, sensible movements, and record-keeping prevent disease spread.
Why it Matters: Biosecurity failures turn single-hive issues into apiary-wide losses.
Step-by-Step: Flame-scorch or disinfect woodenware; rotate out old comb; avoid sharing frames between apiaries; quarantine incoming colonies; keep a disease log and photos.
Seasonality & Climate: Comb rotation pairs well with spring build-up and post-harvest periods.
Common Pitfalls: Reusing suspect comb, moving kit between yards without cleaning, and ignoring minor brood issues.
Tools & Materials: Blowtorch or approved disinfectants, spare frames/foundation, labelled storage, and PPE.
